    • Constructor Detail

      • Simulation

        public Simulation(int timeResolution)
        Create a new simulation.

      • Simulation

        public Simulation(int timeResolution,
          NeuronCollection<? extends ComponentConfiguration> neurons,
          SynapseCollection<? extends ComponentConfiguration> synapses)
        Create a new simulation. Sets the time resolution of all given Neurons and Synapses to match that of this Simulation and resets them.

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset the simulation.

      • setTimeResolution

        public void setTimeResolution(int timeResolution)
        Set the time resolution of the simulation, and reset it.

      • getTimeResolution

        public int getTimeResolution()
        Get the time resolution of the simulation.

      • getStepPeriod

        public double getStepPeriod()
        Get the duration in seconds of each simulation step.

      • step

        public void step()
        Simulate one time step.

      • run

        public void run(int steps)
        Run the simulation for the given number of steps. This should be used in preference to using a loop of a fixed number of iterations that only calls step() as it allows for more efficient use of OpenCL execution by avoiding unnecessary buffer transfers between each step.

      • getStep

        public long getStep()
        Returns the current simulation step.

      • getTime

        public double getTime()
        Returns the current simulation time in seconds.

      • getNeurons

        public NeuronCollection<? extends ComponentConfiguration> getNeurons()
        Returns the neurons in this simulation.
        Returns:
        The NeuronCollection belonging to this simulation.

      • getSynapses

        public SynapseCollection<? extends ComponentConfiguration> getSynapses()
        Returns the synapses in this simulation.
        Returns:
        The SynapseCollection belonging to this simulation.
